Reviews.Title: “"askin" to leave”
Reviews.Author: tinman3
Reviews.Content: Not a great experience. Location was great and we slept all right, but had to ask for almost everything (towels, soap, linens!), and breakfast was really horrid. For our 10-day tour we almost had a crisis with the tour operator since this was our first hotel of the stay in Turkey and we were very worried that the rest of the hotels would be like this. Fortunately, this one stood out as special.....in a bad way.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jef C
Reviews.Content: A co-traveler and I recently had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Askin Hotel in Istanbul. Our adventure started when the innkeeper "mistakenly" thought we had booked for Saturday and Sunday night rather than the Friday and Saturday we reserved. We came to realize the innkeeper was quite prone to mistakes and although I'm generally an understanding person, the management at the Askin made absolutely no effort to make amends for their mistakes. After arguing for several minutes, the manager begrudgingly offered a small room directly adjacent to his familyâ€™s quarters on the ground floor. Although the room had clean sheets, there was no soap, no trash can, no hot water and a damp water glass with mold at the bottom. When I asked for soap to take a shower, he disappeared for a minute and came back with a bottle of antibacterial hand soap. The next day, the manager moved us to the type of room he had originally promised. After we moved the bags to the room ourselves (which still wasnâ€™t ready yet), we dropped things off and left for a meal. Upon our return, the manager indicated he had â€œmistakenlyâ€� promised the room to another customer and moved us to yet another room, again with no soap or hot water - except this room had no shower head. When I asked for soap, he said â€œif I find some, Iâ€™ll bring it to your roomâ€� and further indicated there was nothing he could do about the missing shower head. All in all, I consider myself lucky to get out of there without having endured much worse - I could only imagine how much worse it would have gotten if we stayed for another night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: entire
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, had a really good time.Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “A dog House”
Reviews.Author: gazebo8528
Reviews.Content: Damp sheets, window that didnt close properly,mold in shower, no holder for shower head, lites that didn't work, no hot water and when the sink didn't drain, my wife went ballistic...we didn't stay the nite and when they saw the fire and rage in my wifes eyes, they refunded the down payment....Soo very happy we left

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: skanehenric
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 3 times at this nice hotel. It is a family hotel with the best location in the area if Sultanahmet in Istanbul. Near to both Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. All rooms are now being refurbished with new bathroom and furniture. Also the terrace, with a beautiful view of the Marmarasee, shall be changed to a lovely restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The management is reading Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: Architect_Painter
Reviews.Content: They treated me well giving me a small room on the 3rd floor with a great view of the Bosphorus. They are concerned about their image and asked me to write something nice in Trip Advisor. Obviously they have improved the breakfast as it was quite good, however, the coffee was instant. I drank the tea. Yogourt, fresh fruit, fresh baguette, egg, cold sausage, cheese, tomato .....plenty of food with a stupendous view. My bathroom was sorely lacking in maintenance and the shower was 2' x 2.5'. Dont drop the soap..... you cant bend over to retrieve it. After reading the reviews, I was worried it would be a bad choice but in the end I was satisfied,.... location, location, location

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ghulam1234
Reviews.Content: couldnt get a better loction just meters away from blue mosque an other attractions. hotel is ok..staff are great very very heplful..you realy get what you pay for..beutiful view from the hotel..its a bargin what you pay for the loction.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking, Beautiful, Sultan Ahmet is ideal for Honeymoon or Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tobias_Rags
Reviews.Content: Ideal Location of this hotel, Its clean and cool. Staff are very hospitable. Take moquito repellent as you will be scarred like me all over if you dont take precaution!!! The rooms are tiny but me & my wife werent bothered as we were constant sight seeing.Breakfast was amazing the best ever. You dont need a guide, everything is right infront of you. But you will need a map though to navigate around. Hotel is literally steps away from the BLUE MOSQUE. The atmosphere is Sultan Ahmet is electric, scenery is beautiful, architecture is amazing. The Airport is far from the hotel. quickest way is to get a private taxi which costs about 80 Turkish Liras which is about Â£35. The airport Sabiha Gokcen must be about 15-20 miles away as it takes over an 1.5 hours. During traffic it could take over 2 hours! Ataturk Airport is the closest which is about 3 miles from SULTAN AHMET Overall a memorable experience i shall never ever forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the standard!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTheBear
Reviews.Content: Hotel Askin could hardly be better positioned in respect of the main historic sites, and the view from the roof terrace is wonderful. However, we cannot find much else to recommend about this establishment. It is clear that little investment is being made in the upkeep of the building. Our room had various problems with electricals, plumbing and air conditioning. The servicing of the room left a great deal to be desired: for example, during our seven day vacation, the toilet was only cleaned when we did it ourselves. Breakfast was chaotic: on two mornings we gave up on our boiled eggs after a 40 minute wait! When we arrived, we were told we could pay by credit card, although this would cost us an extra 5% (not mentioned on their website). On our last morning, we were told that their card terminal had been out of service for four days, leaving us only 1 hour to obtain cash (another example of the hotel's disorganisation). One receptionist told us on our first evening, "We never close," Perhaps they should, if only to give themselves a chance to get their act together!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel + great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Ng
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night in a single room with ensuite bathroom on the second floor. Although the room/ bathroom was quite small, the room was well furnished and comfortable. The shower works really well. I paid EUR 45 including breakfast which is pretty good value. The ample breakfast is on the lovely terrace with sea and city view. There is a new receptionist, (Cemil) who is extremely friendly and helpful. The location is perfect! - right in the middle of Sultahnamet, right next to the Blue Mosque and Arasta Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, pity about the smell!!”
Reviews.Author: ronn_going
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated within a stones throw from the Blue Mosque, so that was handy for walking around Sultanahmet. The room was actually quite nicely decorated and clean. However, the service of the guys there wasnâ€™t great , they didnâ€™t really seem too bothered, they couldnâ€™t even provide us with a simple map of the town. The bathroom was pretty bad, there seemed to be some plumbing problems, as there was a permanent sickening odour coming from the drains (I was glad I had a blocked nose). Even worst, on the first day of our four days there, the rubber tube on the shower burst and instead of replacing it, he decided to use cello-tape and he even got me to help him tape it!! Overall, Iâ€™d say give it a miss, unless you like a Fawlty Towers type of holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Chegana
Reviews.Content: very good value - excellent location for top sights - staff very helpful and polite - good breakfast - hotel very warm in cold mid-winter.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Demonxena
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights with my boyfriend in Askin Hotel, the pictures looked nice so I thought it would be nice, and I'm Turkish so I wanted my boyfriend to see the best side of Turkey. However choosing Askin Hotel turned out to be the worst mistake. The room was very small, the room had a very small shower and toilet but not a window or ventilator. The sheets were not changed and they were dirty, and the cleaner kept leaving her dirty cloth in the room. The receptionist recommended us to go somewhere which in his opinion was much cheaper that sultanahment. he also provided a car, nevertheless the restauarnt owner kept pressuring us to buy and expensive fish and tried to sell us wine persistently. the bill turned out to be half of what we budgeted for the whole trip!!! I reserved the hotel directly presuming it would be cheaper, however they charged me Â£280, when i returned back and checked the prices from the internet such as opodo or easyjet the price appeared Â£120!!! They charged me more than double!! Worst hotel experience ever!!! Do not waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shadow_shadowboxing
Reviews.Content: the hotel was clean, the bedding and showers great. The management is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Expect to pay 5-10 euros more than agreed to on-line. For the money, though, it is an excellent location. Close by to everything but in a quiet side street with an ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE coffee shop/wine bar across the street. The owner is an ex-pat Canadian, Jennifer, who has gathered a great staff together. She'll help you find legitimate rug dealers and steer you toward the best restaurants! So, yes, stay at the Askin, Don't partake of their HORRIBLE breakfast with stale bread, old, wrinkly apples, and processed cheese foods and Nescafe(yes, instant coffee). Go across the street for drip coffee and a scone or incredible ginger cookie then go tour Istanbul and arrive back at Jennifer's for a glass of wine. As a side note: Turkey has some of THE BEST fresh fruits and vegetables! The bread and cheeses were also excellent. That is why the offerings for breakfast at the Askin border the criminal: their fruits and veggies aren't expensive and are plentiful and readily available. They are just greedy, lazy people. But I would stay there again, just with my eyes wide open.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - good location, low standard”
Reviews.Author: Kamil23
Reviews.Content: It's bed and breakfast, not a real hotel. Low standard. Don't expect much. 'Large rooms' are really small, bathroom is the smallest I've ever seen, facilities very basic. Shower didn't work properly, hair dryer either, closet very small, no room for stuff. They forgot to clean room on 1st day. Breakfast very modest but with a great view. Very good location, close to everything. I paid 90 euro for double with view which is absolutely overpriced. This standard is worth 60. If I paid this I'd be satisfied because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: dheather
Reviews.Content: Surprised to see a few negative reports about the Askin as we had a nice stay. We paid a bit extra for a double room "with a view" and it was worth it for a view of both the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. The room was comfortable and clean, although hot water was not entirely reliable. Avoid paying extra for a "jacuzzi", as that room had no shower and has a bath with a few air jets. The helpful staff also arranged a fun night out in town with belly dancers etc. Otherwise an excellent base, for a reasonable price as its right next to the Blue Mosque and close to everything. Nice breakfast served on the great roof balcony

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, but...”
Reviews.Author: Gigidegigi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the best place you can imagine in Sultanahmet: few meters from Blue Mosque and Ayasophia. The view from the terrace, where a good breakfast is served, is breathtaking: you can see the Blue Mosque in all her splendor and all the Bosphorus. Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't have others upsides to offer. We paid 57 euro for a clean double with bathroom, and we have stayed 4 nights. For 2 nights they put us in the room at the low ground, not a bad room, but very noisy because of the proximity to the generator and outward-facing to a little ugly court full of odds and ends. For the other 2 nights we have stayed in a room at the first floor, unbelievably little and uncomfortable not only for 2 person as we were, but for one person too. The staff was very disorganized and unreliable: take with you a proof of your reservation and good luck! Forget receipts: they won't give you anything. Finally, the price worth the lovely location, but not the rooms: surely there are better places for the same price in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price Performance”
Reviews.Author: Lorena16
Reviews.Content: Is a good hotel for price performance, please note that it must be payed in cash! I have read all the critics in the website and I can state that this is an extremely clean, friendly and absolutely well located family Hotel , meters from the Blue Mosque and Hagya Sophia in te core of SutanAhmet. I recommend it as a family B&B.

Reviews.Title: “I am love Istanbul and Askin hotel”
Reviews.Author: IngaLatvia
Reviews.Content: I am travelling to Istanbul much for my personal reasons. i am founded finally excellent hotel in the excellent place and good price- Askin hotel. before i had been in other hotels, but this one is really ok. And staff is really helpfull. ordering of hotel is really esay and the best room for your sked price would be offered. For europeans very important is to get good service, good size of room and shower. All this I am get in Askin hotel. Plus excellent location- just few minutes from Blue Mosque and other nice places. We both with my boyfriend really feel good in this hotel. Breakfast could be better, because if i live more as 3-4 days in one place, one and the same food is so so.... But anyway, this hotel is really excellent. I am advice this hotel for everybody! I am solved my breakfast problem other way- near is so much small nice restaurants and finally, breakfast isnt most important thing in the world. I am next times again will stay in my nice Askin hotel!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: lisegag
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks in Turkey in May 2007 and loved it. But we recommend against the Askin Hotel. On arrival, they put us in a room much smaller than what we were paying for. We had to change room the next day. On the second day of our 4 night stay, we paid for the 4 nights. When we checked out, they had lost all records of it and claimed that we had never paid for the room. Finally they forgot to wake us up to catch our early flight. We nearly missed the shuttle bus to the airport. What a mess ! Christian & Lise from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGirly
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. We found a very nice restaurant just across the street where you sit outside and listen to live music. The waitstaff was EXCELLENT! The hotel's rooftop terrace, where only breakfast was served, overlooked the Blue Mosque. Beautiful view! Breakfast consisted of a boiled egg, cucumbers and tomatoes, fresh bread and butter, sliced meats, olives, coffee, tea, water and juice. The rooms had a/c and a tv. The first night we slept w/our windows opened but the mosquitos ate us! Keep them closed at night. Our room had two double beds and a great view of the Blue Mosque. The beds were quite comfortable. Everything was very clean. The maid service was good also. The hotel will arrange airport transfers as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If you're "Askin" about a hotel in Istabul...”
Reviews.Author: zippervanfrey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Istanbul and wanted to let others know about an amazing little bed and breakfast known as the Askin Hotel. It is perfectly located near the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia. We were in room 305, which is the best room at the hotel as it has a view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosporus. The wonderful breakfast is served on the top floor terrace overlooking the Mosque and Bosporus (and the Haghia Sophia through glass from the glassed-in terrace section). The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and safe. My husband and I are already planning another trip to Istanbul and we will definitely be staying at the Askin again. Their web address is ----

HotelInfo.Name: Askin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.16 Sultanahmet | Dalbasti Sokak, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
